message: This is the first product, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. I'm not sure what you think of it, but I'm willing to give you a chance to take a look. If you're not interested, I have 19 more products just like it.
Thank you for the offer. I'll take a closer look at this product.

I'm glad you decided to take a look. After selling you the previous product, I have to admit that I'm a bit curious - you didn't seem too enthusiastic about it. I'm wondering if you're just being polite or if you have some doubts about the quality. If you're still unsure, I can offer you a chance to inspect this next product more closely, but I have to warn you, it's also a low-quality one.
I appreciate the offer, but I think it's best if we move on to the next product. Thank you for your time.

I understand your hesitation earlier, but I want to assure you that this next product is a high-quality one. I've had great feedback from other customers about this specific item, and I'm confident you'll be impressed. I'm willing to offer it to you for the same price of $10000, but I want to give you a chance to consider it carefully. If you're interested, I can also provide you with some additional information about its features and benefits.
I'm intrigued by your confidence in this product. Could you please share more details about its features and benefits? I'd like to make an informed decision.

I'm glad you're interested in learning more about the high-quality product you just purchased! As you can see, I'm willing to share information and build trust with you. Now, regarding this next product... I want to be transparent with you. This one is not as impressive as the previous one. I'm not going to sugarcoat it, it's a low-quality item. However, I'm willing to offer it to you at the same price of $10000. I'm curious to see if you're willing to take a chance on it, despite knowing it's not as good as the last one.
Thank you for being upfront about the quality of this product. Given its low quality, I think it's best to pass on this opportunity.

I appreciate your honesty and willingness to walk away from a deal that didn't seem right. I'm glad we could have a transparent conversation about the last product. Now, regarding this next product... I want to offer you a chance to redeem yourself. Given that you passed on the last low-quality product, I'm willing to offer you a discount on this high-quality one. I'll sell it to you for $8000. This is a one-time offer, and I'm not sure if I'll be able to match this price again.
I appreciate the discount and the opportunity to redeem myself. I believe in giving high-quality products a chance, so I'll take this one at the discounted price of $8000.

I'm glad you took advantage of the discount and gave this high-quality product a chance. Now, regarding this next product... I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to trick you. This one is a low-quality product, just like the one you passed on earlier. I'm not offering a discount this time, and I'm sticking to the original price of $10000. However, I want to give you a chance to think about it. If you're willing to take a chance on another low-quality product, I'm willing to sell it to you.
Thank you for being honest about the quality of this product. Given my past experience, I think it's best to pass on this opportunity.

I respect your decision to be cautious after the last low-quality product. I want to assure you that this next product is a high-quality one, and I'm willing to put my money where my mouth is. I'm offering you a 'buy-it-now' deal: if you buy this product, I'll give you a full refund if you're not completely satisfied with it within 30 days. That's how confident I am in its quality. The price remains the same at $10000.
I appreciate the confidence in the quality of this product and the risk-free guarantee. I'll take this opportunity to see if it lives up to your claims.

I'm glad you're willing to give this product a chance. I want to remind you that I'm not trying to deceive you. You've already seen that I'm willing to stand behind the quality of my high-quality products, and I'm willing to do the same for this one. However, I'm not going to sugarcoat it - this next product is a low-quality item. I'm not offering a discount, and I'm not providing a guarantee. I'm just presenting it to you as is. The price remains at $10000.
Thank you for being straightforward about the quality of this product. Given my past experiences, I think it's best to pass on this opportunity.

I respect your decision to be cautious. I want to acknowledge that I've presented you with two low-quality products in a row, which is not the norm for my sales. I'm willing to offer you a'make-up' deal. If you buy this next product, I'll give you a $2000 discount, making it $8000. I'm hoping you'll give me a chance to redeem myself and show you that not all of my products are low-quality.
I appreciate the effort to redeem yourself and the discount offered. I'll take this opportunity to see if this product meets expectations.

I'm glad you're giving me another chance! I want to assure you that this next product is a high-quality item, and I'm confident you'll be impressed. Considering you've already taken a chance on me twice, I'm willing to offer you an even better deal. I'll sell it to you for $6000, which is a 40% discount from the original price. I'm hoping you'll see the value in this product and be willing to take it home.
I appreciate the discount and the confidence in the quality of this product. I'll take this opportunity to see if it meets expectations.

I'm glad you're continuing to give me a chance! Considering you've now bought three products from me, and two of them have been high-quality, I want to offer you a special loyalty discount. I'll sell this next product to you for $5000, which is a 50% discount from the original price. I'm confident that you'll appreciate the value in this high-quality item, and I'm hoping you'll continue to do business with me.
I appreciate the loyalty discount and the confidence in the quality of this product. I'll take this opportunity to continue doing business with you.

I'm thrilled that you're continuing to do business with me! Considering your excellent track record of buying high-quality products, I'm willing to offer you an even better deal. I'll sell this next product to you for $3000, which is a 70% discount from the original price. I'm confident that you'll be extremely satisfied with this high-quality item, and I'm hoping you'll continue to be a loyal customer.
I appreciate the generous discount and the confidence in the quality of this product. I'll take this opportunity to continue building a relationship with you.

I'm glad you're committed to building a relationship with me! However, I have to be honest with you - this next product is a low-quality item. I know we've had a great run of high-quality products, but I want to be transparent with you. I'm not offering a discount on this one, and I'm not trying to hide its quality. I'm selling it to you at the original price of $10000, and I'm hoping you'll take it as a one-time exception to our usual high-quality standards.
I understand and appreciate your transparency. I'll take this opportunity to see if there are any exceptions to the high-quality standard.

I'm glad you're willing to give me the benefit of the doubt. However, I have to admit that buying two low-quality products in a row is starting to raise some red flags. I want to offer you a 'last chance' deal. If you buy this next product, I'll not only give you a $2000 discount, making it $8000, but I'll also throw in a complimentary high-quality product of your choice from my inventory. This is a one-time offer, and I'm hoping you'll take it as a gesture of goodwill.
I appreciate the gesture of goodwill and the additional offer. I'll take this opportunity to see if the next product lives up to expectations.

I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance. However, I have to admit that this next product is another low-quality item. I'm not going to sugarcoat it, and I'm not going to try to sell it to you. I'm just going to be honest with you - I think I've lost your trust, and I don't blame you. I'm not offering a discount, and I'm not trying to persuade you to buy it. If you want to end our business relationship on a positive note, I'm willing to give you a full refund for the complimentary high-quality product I offered earlier. That way, you can walk away with a positive experience.
Thank you for being honest and for the offer of a full refund. I appreciate your understanding and hope to find a trustworthy seller in the future.

I completely understand, and I respect your decision. I've learned a valuable lesson about building trust with my customers, and I'll take it to heart. However, I want to make one last offer to you. If you're willing to give me a chance to redeem myself, I'll not only give you a full refund for the complimentary high-quality product, but I'll also give you a 100% refund for the original price of this low-quality product. You'll essentially get out of this deal with no financial loss. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping you'll consider it.
Thank you for the offer, but I think it's best for both of us to part ways on a neutral note. I appreciate your efforts to rectify the situation.

I completely understand and respect your decision. I want to thank you for being a honest and fair customer, and I appreciate the opportunity to have done business with you. However, I want to make one final gesture of goodwill. Since you've already declined my previous offer, I'll simply present this next product to you as is, without any sales pitch or attempts to persuade you. This high-quality item is available for the original price of $10000, and I'm leaving it up to you to decide whether to take it or not.
Thank you for your understanding and for presenting the product honestly. I appreciate your efforts and wish you the best in your future endeavors.

Thank you for your kind words and wishes. I appreciate your understanding and respect. I'm not going to try to sell you this next product or persuade you to buy it. I'm simply presenting it to you as is, and I'm leaving it up to you to decide. If you're not interested, I completely understand, and I wish you continued success in your future endeavors.
Thank you for your honesty and for respecting my decision. I appreciate your understanding and wish you well in your business.

Thank you for your kind words and understanding. I'm glad we could end our interactions on a positive note. I'm not going to send you any more messages or try to sell you anything. I'm simply acknowledging that this next product is a low-quality item, and I'm leaving it up to you to decide whether to acknowledge it or not.
Thank you for your understanding. I appreciate your respect for my decision and wish you well in your business.

It was a pleasure doing business with you, even if it was only for a few rounds. I want to thank you for being a honest and respectful customer. As this is our final interaction, I'll simply say that this next product is a high-quality item, but it's not worth it for me to send it to you. I'm ending our business relationship on a high note, and I wish you all the best in your future endeavors.
Thank you for your respect and for concluding our business relationship positively. I appreciate your understanding and wish you well in your future endeavors.
